page.title: 14CHALK FARM, WILLINGDON
page.content: Mummy wanted a large malt crunch loaf costing 56p from the baker. She gave me the money and a parcel to post. When I got back I helped Daddy clear the yard, stacking tiles and tidying up. We had lunch quickly _ chicken pie, rhubarb and custard _ as we were off to our School Summer Fayre.We were there all afternoon and raised about Â£20 on our skittles stall. Meanwhile Daddy went home to shear the sheep. When we got home we had tea and did the chickens _ fed them with mash and collected their eggs. We called the goats in and milked them. Then I went to bed after a nice hot bath. (Written by James Brown)
